intro: Pavetta talbotii, commonly known as the African pavetta, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a glossy surface. It produces small, white or pinkish flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by small, spherical berries.
